subject: ClassNotFoundException, sometimes
msgSnippet: I m working on setting up some junit test cases for an application that s been around a while.  I have some tests running via ant, but I have a strange
messageBody:
I'm working on setting up some junit test cases for an application that's been around a while. I have some tests running via ant, but I have a strange situation.

When use "ant clean" to delete all the compiled classes, then "ant test" (which depends on the compile task, so it'll compile before it runs the tests) to run the junit tests (via the junit ant task), it works fine. The code compiles and the junit tests work.

However, if I immediately run "ant test" to re-run the junit tests, it fails with a NoClassDefFoundError, complaining about not being able to find a particular class in a 3rd-party library I'm using. The correct .jar file for the library is in the classpath.

If I do "ant clean", then "ant test" it works.

Any ideas?

Here's the "test" snippet from my ant script:

<target name="test" depends="compile.tests" description="Runs JUnit tests">
<junit printsummary="false" haltonfailure="true" showoutput="true">
<classpath refid="test.classpath"/>
<formatter type="brief" usefile="false"/>
<batchtest>
<fileset dir="build/classes" includes="**/*.class"/>
</batchtest>
</junit>
</target>

David
